channel.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
channel.description:
# [color=tomato]Welcome to the Weekly Monday Discussion![/color] Feel free to use this thread to discuss ideas.
[details=Interview with a Celebrity Queue Representative]
**Chloe:** "Yo kat, what are your thoughts on my queue ideas?"
**kat:** "tbh we should poll it ![image|23x23](upload://zzhYo8i2gVtrx2QcUEK30hU0Dme.png)"
**Chloe:** "Weekly Monday Discussion? :eyes:"
**kat:** "no it's thursday you can't do this"
**Chloe:** "Of course I can."
**kat:** "i will delete it"
**Chloe:** "Wtf number are we even on"
**kat:** "aaaaaaaaaaaaaa"
**DatBird:** "6?"
**Arete:** "6."
**kat:** *angry noises*
**Chloe:** "Okay I sent you guys a draft."
**kat:** "where are the funny comments smh"
**Chloe:** *adds something vaguely funny.*
**kat:** "4/10. easily room for 'its not monday' banter by me smh"
**Chloe:** "fine." [/details]
--- **Please read all of these (And read them carefully) before responding!**
[color=tomato]**Idea 1**[/color] - The mod/review team will use their best judgement to place games throughout the "Waiting to Start" portion of the queue, in order to maximize variety in terms of game size and game type. Reviewed games will no longer simply be placed at the bottom.
ie. We will attempt to make sure that there are not multiple mashes within a short period of time, or a large amount of vanilla setups clumped together. (This is similar to what we do now, but, rather than scrambling to find a small setup, we will have organization weeks/months beforehand).
[color=tomato]**Idea 2**[/color] - Create two queues. One for small games (15p maximum) and one for large games (more than 15 players). Reviewed games will be placed at the bottom of the respective queue.
[color=tomato]**Idea 3**[/color] - Create two queues. One for small *and/or* open/semi-open setups, and one for large *and/or* closed/rolemadness setups. Reviewed games will be placed at the bottom of the respective queue.
[color=tomato]**Idea 4**[/color] - Implement a scheduled queue system. Users will request a date for their game to run. Slots in the schedule will be pre-determined months beforehand, and will be separated based on gamesize. An example of a scheduled queue system is the [Mafia Universe Queue](https://www.mafiauniverse.com/forums/threads/29224-2021-Unified-Queue-Thread).
[color=tomato]**Idea 5**[/color] - Change the queue system, but to something else. (Explain your idea in a reply)
[color=tomato]**Idea 6**[/color] - Don't change anything.
---
**The following poll has public results.** Do not vote if you are not comfortable with people viewing your selection. **Results are always visible**, but we suggest that you answer *before* looking at them, as to not bias your choice.
[poll type=multiple results=always min=1 max=6 public=true chartType=bar] # Multiple answers can be selected: * Idea 1 * Idea 2 * Idea 3 * Idea 4 * Idea 5 * Idea 6 [/poll]
[color=tomato]**Final note:**[/color] The results of this poll and discussion may not reflect the mod/review team's decision, but answers will be taken into consideration and play a role in our selection.

Read full topic

item.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
bruh

orangeandblack5:

I just think sorting by game type makes way more sense than sorting purely by playercount, and even Idea 3 interlinks those two things in a way I don’t think is particularly well defined. I’d be down to do Idea 3 with games larger than 17p automatically relegated to SFM instead of VFM, but I do think having games with really small playercounts run in a different queue also makes sense rather than having them hold up 9-17p games.

Read full topic

item.description:
It’s Idea 3

Read full topic

item.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
for example, the CDFM queue had 5 categories

FM, VFM, SFM, TFM, and XFM

FM would just be FoL here, as it was “official” games as part of the on season - in the absence of actual FoL games, this category could easily be ignored

XFM were “experimental” setups, reserved for small games in PMs or any time the mods wanted to try something out - think of it like the Experimental FoL games we had here. Thus, with a total lack of FoL nowadays, this category can also be ignored

The other three categories were described as follows:

VFM games are Vanilla FM games, with emphasis put on standard Town-vs-Mafia gameplay. VFM games will include only standard roles and no special mechanics and can be either open or semi-open setups.

SFM games are Special FM games, a category that basically contains everything that isn’t a VFM game. Any game with third-party roles, a closed setup, hidden mechanics, ITAs, or any other unique features should go here.

Lastly, TFM games are for either Tiny FM games (less than 9 players) or Turbo FM games (phases under 12 hours, but generally turbos have phases measured in minutes, such as 15/5). These should be separate as they don’t take nearly as much effort to play or host, so can be run much more often.

I think this breakdown makes a lot more sense than any of the proposed multi-queues, as it effectively guarantees that you can at any point find a game that aligns with your interests. I believe ToS FM also currently uses a similar breakdown, albeit they have Episodes for their standard FM queue. I’m not sure if they still use TFM or retired the category, but it never encapsulated turbos there even thought that makes a lot of sense to me. They did also have GFM for big games (and I mean really big games), but we could always take this category for games larger than 17p if we want to allow more density of SFM games by allowing larger ones to run in a separate queue.

I just think sorting by game type makes way more sense than sorting purely by playercount, and even Idea 3 interlinks those two things in a way I don’t think is particularly well defined. I’d be down to do Idea 3 with games larger than 17p automatically relegated to SFM instead of VFM, but I do think having games with really small playercounts run in a different queue also makes sense rather than having them hold up 9-17p games.

Read full topic

item.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
thinking out loud

incorporating miscs in the FM queue somehow might be awkward given there’s an audience who doesn’t really care for miscs and an audience who probably plays more miscs than FM

having it in place of FM would be bad probably

maybe we could try to sort it so they don’t overlap with larger games?

hmm

Read full topic

item.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
Marshal:

what if we actually factored miscs into queue stuff

those take up playerbase

they run seperately but a danganronpa game for example requires a level of commitment to the game from players arguably similar to a game

some miscs i’d agree with

big brother is an example of one i don’t think would but given every misc in the queue is probably dangan or related to it, i think this is worth discussing

SirDerpsAlot:

I despise MU que system because they open signups so long before games start and idk if I’ll have time bt the time they start

they’re experimenting with sit and go games which aren’t like this and just start when they fill now

Read full topic

item.title: Weekly Monday Discussion #6 - Queue Changes
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Chloe:

Idea 1 - The mod/review team will use their best judgement to place games throughout the “Waiting to Start” portion of the queue, in order to maximize variety in terms of game size and game type. Reviewed games will no longer simply be placed at the bottom.

ie. We will attempt to make sure that there are not multiple mashes within a short period of time, or a large amount of vanilla setups clumped together. (This is similar to what we do now, but, rather than scrambling to find a small setup, we will have organization weeks/months beforehand).

Idea 2 - Create two queues. One for small games (15p maximum) and one for large games (more than 15 players). Reviewed games will be placed at the bottom of the respective queue.

Idea 3 - Create two queues. One for small and/or open/semi-open setups, and one for large and/or closed/rolemadness setups. Reviewed games will be placed at the bottom of the respective queue.

Idea 4 - Implement a scheduled queue system. Users will request a date for their game to run. Slots in the schedule will be pre-determined months beforehand, and will be separated based on gamesize. An example of a scheduled queue system is the Mafia Universe Queue.

two queues leads to bigger games taking obscene amounts of time to actually come out
because they have to wait for other big games
given that a lot of fun big games are just in the 17p range, I think 2 is legitimately horrible

idea 3 is meh
smaller rolemadness games get shoved in the clogged queue for no good reason

idea 4 would work if we had modbot
but we don’t, do we

Read full topic
